default: (a) a {@item leather armor|phb} or (b) {@item scale mail|phb}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
Any simple weapon and a {@item dagger|phb}

classFeatures.name: Metallurgy
entries: At first level, you learn how to metabolize metals and harness their power.

entries.name: Allomantic Reserve
entries: As an Allomancer, you keep a collection of metal flakes and powders as well as tools like files and metal clippers for replenishing your supply. You can ingest quantities of these metals for burning at a later time.

Your Allomantic Reserve is the maximum quantity of metal you can store in your body. The Allomancer table shows the size of your reserve for your level. You regain all expended charges on a long rest.

entries.name: Ingesting Metal
entries: Generally speaking, eating metal isn't a particularly enjoyable experience. As such, every Allomancer comes up with a different way to cope. The most common is suspending the metal in an alcohol solution, but some cook it into food or mix it into their canteen.

entries.name: Burning Metal
entries: At first level, you know how to burn six of the allomantic metals. You prepare your charges for burning each type of metal. To do so, divide your Allomantic Reserve among the metals available for you to burn, up to the cap listed in the Ability Cap column.

For example, if your Allomantic Reserve is 12 and your Ability Cap is 4, a valid distribution would be 3 charges in Iron, 3 charges in Steel, 2 charges in Zinc, and 4 charges in Brass. You do not have to places charges in all of your metals, but you cannot go over the cap for any.

You can change the distribution of your charges on a long rest. Doing so requires time spent mixing the correct proportions of metal and preparing for ingestion: at least 1 minute per charge moved between metals.

Unlike spellcasters, Allomancers don't give any indication when they're burning metal unless the effects are visibly apparent. There are no verbal or somatic components, and the only material component is your internal reserve. Additionally, no exceptional concentration is required to burn metal. As such, Allomancers have no restriction on how many different metals they burn at the same time.

entries.name: The Major Allomantic Metals
entries: As a bonus action, you can choose to burn any number of metals, expending a charge for each one. One charge will let you burn metal for one minute. It is a free action to keep and already burning metal going, but you still must expend a charge to do so. It is also a free action to stop burning a metal.

entries.name: Tin
entries: A soft, flakey, white metal. When burning tin all of your senses become greatly enhanced. You gain proficiency in Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks if you do not already have it, and your bonus is doubled if you do.

entries.name: Pewter
entries: A dull grey metal. When burning pewter your body and strength are improved. You have resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries.name: Iron
entries: A rough, dark grey metal. When burning iron you can track and pull on sources of metal. Faint blue lines only you can see extend from you to every source of metal in 30 feet. This effect cannot penetrate barriers as thick as 3 feet of wood or dirt, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or a thin sheet of lead. Additionally, when burning iron you can spend a reaction to redirect a projectile aimed at a creature other than you in the area. When you do so, the creature effectively gains half-cover for that attack.

entries.name: Steel
entries: A smooth, light grey metal. When burning steel you can push on sources of metal. As an action, you can attack with your {@item Allomantic Steelpush|jbassin}.

entries.name: Zinc
entries: A craggy, reflective, white metal. When burning zinc you can dampen the emotions of those around you. You gain proficiency in Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks if you do not already have it, and your bonus is doubled if you do.

entries.name: Brass
entries: A pale orange metal. When burning brass you can riot the emotions of those around you. As an action, you can flare the aggression of a creature within 30ft of you. When a creature's emotions are flared in this fashion, they have disadvantage when attacking someone other than you. You can maintain this effect on one creature at a time. Targets who can't be frightened are unaffected.

classFeatures.name: Allomantic Specialty
entries: At 2nd level, you choose to concentrate in a single Allomantic Specialty from the list of available specialties. Your specialization grants you a feature from this path at 2nd level and then again at 5th level, 9th level, 12th level, 15th level, and 18th level.

classFeatures.name: Minor Metal Burning
entries: At 3rd level, you learn how to burn the four minor metals. Minor metals burn more slowly than the major six, and as such one charge will last for an hour.

entries.name: Copper
entries: A bright orange metal. When burning copper you shield signs of magic around you. All objects within 30ft of you appear mundane to {@spell detect magic}, {@spell identify}, and other similar effects.

entries.name: Bronze
entries: A striated, dark orange metal. When burning bronze you detect signs of magic around you. If you spend an action studying someone while burning bronze, you learn if they have the capacity for magic. If you spend a minute you learn what class they are. Additionally, you gain advantage on checks to identify illusions.

entries.name: Gold
entries: A shiny, bright yellow metal. When burning gold light collects around you. A soft glow surrounds you and for a 15ft radius from you all darkness is dim light and all dim light is bright light. You can choose the color of the light and can turn it off and back on again within the hour without spending an additional charge.

entries.name: Electrum
entries: A pale, light yellow metal. When burning electrum light drains from the area. Creatures within 15ft of you have a +5 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. Additionally, you gain proficiency in Stealth (Dexterity) checks if you do not already have it, and your bonus is doubled if you do.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Allomantic Flaring
entries: At 5th level, you gain the ability to flair your specialty metals. Flaring is the act of burning a large quantity of metal at a time to bring out a greater effect.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 7th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Duralumin Burning
entries: When you reach 8th level, your experience with Allomancy has prepared you to burn duralumin. Duralumin (and its primary metal aluminum) burn intensely, and as such their effects have no duration and instead occur instantaneously.

entries.name: Aluminum
entries: When an Allomancer burns aluminum -- or ingests a large enough quantity of it -- it causes all of their reserves to burn up without imparting any effect on the user. This is a good way to flush allomantic metals out of someone's system but would be a tactical error to use in a fight.

entries.name: Duralumin
entries: Duralumin is a brittle, smooth, light grey metal. When it is burned at the same time as other metals, it completely consumes those other metals releasing all of their charges in one spectacular burst. Due to the volatility of the metal, however, its ability cap is always 2, regardless of what level the Allomancer is.

entries.name: Tin
entries: When consumed by duralumin, your eyes become hypersensitive. You gain truesight out to 60ft for a number of minutes equal to the charges expended.

entries.name: Pewter
entries: When consumed by duralumin, your natural healing speeds up immensely to repair any damage. You can immediately spend a number of hit dice equal to the charges of pewter expended, so long as you have the hit dice to spend.

entries.name: Iron
entries: When consumed by duralumin, your ironpull strength and range are greatly increased. You can rip metal weapons, shields, and armor off of creatures within 60ft towards you, disarming them. You can do this for as many charges that were expended. Armor counts as two objects for the calculation.

entries.name: Steel
entries: When consumed by duralumin, your steelpush strength is multiplied many times. You can spend an action to fire a {@item Duralumin Steelpush|jbassin}.

entries.name: Zinc
entries: When consumed by duralumin, your ability to soothe emotion covers a much greater area. You can attempt to dampen all emotion but fear in a number of creatures equal to 2 * number of charges expended within 60ft of you. They must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC (number of charges expended + 12) or become frightened.

entries.name: Brass
entries: When consumed by duralumin, your ability to riot emotion covers a much greater area. You can target a number of creatures equal to how many charges were expended and flare up their confidence and bravery. As a result, they receive temporary hit points equal to 2 * number of charges expended.

entries.name: Copper
entries: When consumed by duralumin, your coppercloud becomes more potent. You can target a single non-artifact magic item and attempt to remove its enchantments. Make either an Arcana (Intelligence) or Insight (Wisdom) check to see if you can discover how to dispell the magic effect. Depending on your result the item may become mundane.

rows: Item's magic effects are dispelled temporarily, for one minute
Item's magic effects are dispelled temporarily, for ten minutes
Item's magic effects are dispelled temporarily, for one hour
Item's magic effects are dispelled temporarily, for one day
Item's magic effects are permanently dispelled

entries.name: Brass
entries: When consumed by duralumin, your ability to read magic signatures is improved. You select one creature within 30ft and read its current state. You learn its current HP, AC, number of remaining spell slots, and its greatest and lowest saving throw modifiers.

entries.name: Gold
entries: When consumed by duralumin, you become a beacon of shining light. A burst of bright light extends out in 150ft from you in every direction. Any invisible objects and creatures immediately become visible, and all traps begin to glow with a soft light, which will remain for the next hour.

entries.name: Electrum
entries: When consumed by duralumin, you gain the ability to collect shadow around you. If in darkness or dim light you become completely invisible. You remain invisible until you next touch bright light or ten minutes pass, whichever occurs first.

classFeatures.name: Lesser Twinburn
entries: At 9th level, you gain the ability to enhance your power output by burning both of your specialty metals at the same time. You can choose to twin metals by spending a bonus action to expend one charge in each. Twinning lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 10th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Crystallized Nothing
entries: At 11th level, you learn to burn Nothing and its alloy orichalum. Nothing is pure crystallized magic, either deposited slowly over time into rock formations or generated quickly through the sacrifice of one or more spellcasters. It is rare and powerful. Due to this, both nothing and orichalum cannot be charged through your regular reserves, but are charged separately instead. It costs 500gp for a single charge, your max is 3 charges regardless of your level's ability cap, and all unused charges are lost on a long rest. Additionally, burning in conjunction with duralumin has no effect. One charge lasts for six seconds.

entries.name: Nothing
entries: A pitch-black, completely smooth metal. When burning you see the near future. Ghostly images of the creatures around you reveal their intentions, allowing you to counter them before they even begin. While burning Nothing, you have advantage on all attack actions and saving throws, and your AC has an additional +5. This bonus does not apply when attacking or being attacked by someone else burning Nothing.

entries.name: Orichalum
entries: A cubic, very dark green metal. When burning you control the near future. A translucent dome of force with a 5ft radius appears around you. Time is stopped outside the dome but continues as normal within it. Two rounds pass with each creature taking its turn as normal, following the initiative order, skipping those outside the dome, and continuing from you. Nothing can pass through the dome; projectiles automatically swing wide and spell effects fizzle out at the border.

classFeatures.name: Allomantic Dragging
entries: At 12th level, you learn to drag your specialty metals, burning them slowly to maintain their effect for longer. As an action, you can drag a metal, expending a charge to make a minor effect last eight hours. You also receive the effects gained from dragging a metal while burning it regularly.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach the 13th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Improved Allomantic Flaring
entries: At 15th level, you learn to extract even more power out of a flare.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach the 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM uses the optional Feats, you can instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Crystallized Something
entries: At 17th level, you gain the ability to burn both Something and its alloy lasinium. Something is pure crystallized phlogiston, the dense red fog that exists between universes. Like Nothing it is expensive and volatile. It follows the same usage rules, except it costs 1000gp per cast instead of 500gp, and your ability cap is 1 instead of 3.

entries.name: Something
entries: A swirling, deep red metal. When burning you can deconstruct the area around you. Choose 8 25ft cubic areas to reduce back to their primordial state. All creatures within an area must attempt a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, each creature takes {@damage 40d6} force damage (or half that on a success) as it is forcibly deconstructed to its base elements. Creatures located in two or more cubes only suffer the effects once. The effect also applies to objects and buildings, which are assumed to fail their saves.

entries.name: Lasinium
entries: A completely pure white metal. When burning you can reconstruct the area around you. Choose up to 7 creatures within 60ft of you to tether to the Weave. Ethereal tendrils wrap around each creature, restoring 100 hit points and curing all diseases and negative effects as they are restored to their healthiest form.

classFeatures.name: Greater Twinburn
entries: At 18th level, you learn to improve your twinburn by burning more metal at a time. You can choose to greater twin metals by spending a bonus action to expend two charges in each. Greater twinning lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach the 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM uses the optional Feats, you can instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Allomantic Recovery
entries: At the 20th level, you learn to pull on Allomantic power directly from the Weave itself. When you begin an encounter with no allomantic reserves, you immediately gain 4 charges in your specialty metals.

subclassFeatures.name: Tin and Pewter Specialization
entries: Allomancy begins from within the body, so it follows that it's best used to enrich the body. Allomancers that specialize in burning tin and pewter focus on how to best strengthen themselves from within, reinforcing against any external force.

entries.name: Stronger Reserves
entries: Starting at level 2, your body adjusts to larger quantities of metal in your system. Your ability cap for your tin and pewter reserves is increased by your Constitution modifier.
Additionally, you gain proficiency in heavy armor and martial weapons.

entries.name: Tineye and Pewterarm
entries: Starting at level 2, you begin to properly adjust to the sensory overload when burning tin. While burning tin you may reroll 1s, 2s, and 3s on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) ability checks. You must take the second roll.

You also learn to distribute your strength throughout your whole body. While burning pewter you may choose to not add your proficiency bonus your attack roll. If the attack lands you may then add your proficiency to the damage instead. Also, burning pewter now gives you resistance to magical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.

entries.name: Tin and Pewter
entries: You learn to flare your tin and pewter to draw out more strength in a short burst.

entries.name: Tin
entries: You gain the ability to flare your tin, painfully overloading your senses and snapping you out of a condition. When a condition requires you to make a saving throw at the end of your turn, you may choose to make it at the beginning instead. Doing so expends 2 tin charges, regardless of the result of the save.

entries.name: Pewter
entries: You gain the ability to flare your pewter, hardening your muscles in preparation for an attack. As a reaction you can flare your pewter, giving you resistance to all non-psychic damage until the end of your next turn. Doing so expends 2 pewter charges.
Starting at level 5 you can also attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

entries.name: Tin and Pewter
entries: You learn to burn your tin and pewter in conjunction for an edge in battle. Your enhanced mind lets you see small tells in your opponents and your enhanced body lets you act on it. While twinning tin and pewter you gain an additional +2 on melee attack rolls. Additionally, enemies you successfully hit with a melee attack have disadvantage on their next attack against you.

entries.name: Tin
entries: You learn to ignore the noise from your improved senses and hone in on specific targets. When dragging tin you gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), Wisdom ({@skill Insight}), and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks.

entries.name: Pewter
entries: You learn to improve the speed of your muscles as well as their strength. When dragging pewter you gain an additional 20ft to your walking and swimming speeds. Additionally, if dragging pewter while taking the attack action you may attack three times instead of twice.

entries.name: Tin
entries: You've become so used to burning tin it has become second nature. When you fail a Wisdom, Intelligence, or Charisma saving throw you may flare your tin and force yourself to focus, allowing you to attempt the saving throw again. Doing so expends 3 tin charges.

entries.name: Pewter
entries: You've become so used to burning pewter it has become second nature. When you make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw you may flare your pewter and harden your body against adverse effects, allowing you to make the save with advantage. Doing so expends 3 pewter charges.

entries.name: Tin and Pewter
entries: You learn to improve your tin and pewter twinning. When greater twinning you also gain advantage on attack rolls.

subclassFeatures.name: Iron and Steel Specialization
entries: Allomancy is tied to the natural metals, so it follows that it's best used to interact with those metals. Allomancers that specialize in burning iron and steel focus on how to best manipulate the forces acting on metals.

entries.name: Stronger Reserves
entries: Starting at level 2, your body adjusts to larger quantities of metal in your system. Your ability cap for your iron and steel reserves is increased by your Dexterity modifier.
Additionally, you gain proficiency in ranged martial weapons.

entries.name: Ironpull and Steelpush
entries: Starting at level 2, you gain better control over your ironpulls. You can now use your ironpull reaction on projectiles aimed at anyone within 30ft, including yourself.
You also learn better put power and accuracy behind your steelpushes. When burning steel you can now spend an action to attack with your {@item Coinshot Steelpush|jbassin}.

entries.name: Iron and Steel
entries: You learn to flare your iron and steel to draw out more strength in a short burst.

entries.name: Iron
entries: You gain the ability to flare your iron, pulling smaller items towards you and yourself towards larger items.

When you flare iron it becomes a free action to pull any metallic object within 30ft to your hands. The object must be at least one size smaller than you and cannot be currently worn or held. Doing so expends an iron charge.

When you flare iron it also becomes a bonus action to pull yourself towards a metallic object within 30ft of you. The object must be either your size or larger. Doing so moves you up to 30ft towards the object in a straight line, avoiding opportunity attacks, and expends an iron charge.

entries.name: Steel
entries: You gain the ability to flare your steel, launching objects even more forcefully at an opponent. You may either use a {@item Flared Coinshot Steelpush|jbassin} or you may use a more conventional ranged weapon and add your proficiency bonus to the damage. Performing either one expends a steel charge.

entries.name: Iron and Steel
entries: You learn to burn your iron and steel in conjunction for an edge in battle. A the beginning of a turn you're twinning iron and steel, you throw a number of tiny metal objects equal to your Dexterity modifier divided by two (with a minimum of one) into the air. Pushing and pulling lets you keep them in orbit around you, building up momentum that you can later release. You may expend an object on any Steelpush to double the damage dice for that attack. Any objects not spent at the end of your turn minute fall to the ground harmlessly.

entries.name: Iron
entries: You learn to keep your ironlines active with more efficient iron use. When dragging iron your blue lines project to metal sources up to 120ft away. You can also pull metal objects towards you so long as they weigh less than five pounds and are not weapons.

entries.name: Steel
entries: You learn to project a small dome of magnetic force around you. When dragging steel you gain +2 to your AC when attacked by metal weapons, both ranged and melee.

entries.name: Iron
entries: You've become so used to burning iron it has become second nature. When any creature other than you within 30ft of you is on the receiving end of a critical hit you may spend your reaction to flare your iron and deflect the attack, canceling the critical effect. Doing so expends 3 iron charges.

entries.name: Steel
entries: You've become so used to burning iron it has become second nature. When you are on the receiving end of a critical hit you may spend your reaction to flare your steel, deflecting the blow and forcing the attacker to roll again to see if they still hit. Doing so expends 3 steel charges.

entries.name: Iron and Steel
entries: You learn to improve your iron and steel twinning. When greater twinning your twinning-empowered projectiles deal an additional 3d6 piercing damage.

subclassFeatures.name: Zinc and Brass Specialization
entries: Allomancy is tied to the disposition of the Allomancer, so it follows that it's best used to modify the dispositions of others. Allomancers that specialize in burning zinc and brass focus on how to best tweak the emotions and mental state of those around them.

entries.name: Stronger Reserves
entries: Starting at level 2, your body adjusts to larger quantities of metal in your system. Your ability cap for your zinc and brass reserves is increased by your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Emotion Die
entries: At 2nd level, you gain an Emotion die you can use to soothe and riot the emotions of others. Your Emotion die's power is based on your level as follows:

entries.name: Soothing
entries: Starting at level 2, you gain greater insight into the emotions of your allies. When burning zinc you can spend an action to apply one of the following buffs to a creature within 30ft. You cannot have multiple buffs active on the same creature, and you cannot have more active buffs than your Charisma modifier. The buffs remain active so long as you continue to burn zinc.

entries.name: Bravery
entries: You dampen the fears and anger of your ally, instilling in them great bravery. They may add your emotion die to an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw they make.

entries.name: Urgency
entries: You soothe away lethargy and drowsiness from your ally, giving them a sense of urgency. They may add twice your emotion die to their speed for one round.

entries.name: Confidence
entries: You remove doubts and jitteriness from your ally, letting them strike true. They may add your emotion die to a ranged or melee attack, but only before they roll to attack.

entries.name: Forethought
entries: You reduce rashness and instinct in your ally, allowing them to change the flow of battle. They may add or subtract your emotion die to their order in the initiative.

entries.name: Decisiveness
entries: You clear indecision from the mind of an ally, granting them the clarity to better choose targets. They may add half your emotion die to their offhand attack roll.

entries.name: Rioting
entries: Also starting at level 2, you gain better control over the feelings of your enemies. When burning brass you can spend an action to apply one of the following debuffs to a creature within 30ft. You cannot have multiple debuffs active on the same creature, and you cannot have more active debuffs than your Charisma modifier. The debuffs remain active so long as you continue to burn brass.

entries.name: Anger
entries: You flare the rage in an enemy, making it sloppy in its attacks. You may subtract your emotion die from their next attack.

entries.name: Confusion
entries: You riot the uncertainty in an enemy, making it doubt its current path. You may subtract thrice your emotion die from their movement on their next turn.

entries.name: Distraction
entries: You enhance the inattention of an enemy, requiring it to use more effort to concentrate. You made add your emotion die to the DC of their next concentration check.

entries.name: Apathy
entries: You drive the indifference of the enemy, dulling its sense of preservation. You may subtract your emotion die from their next Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw.

entries.name: Indecision
entries: You surge an enemy's sense of hesitation, causing it to deliberate over its next move. The creature must succeed on a DC (10 + emotion die) Wisdom saving throw or waste the turn doing nothing.

entries.name: Zinc and Brass
entries: You learn to flare your zinc and brass to draw out more strength in a short burst.

entries.name: Zinc
entries: You gain the ability to flare your zinc, soothing multiple creatures at the same time. You can soothe the fight or flight response in your enemies, increasing their reflex time. Until the beginning of your next turn, all creatures you choose within 60ft have a -2 penalty to their AC. Doing so expends three zinc charges.

entries.name: Brass
entries: You gain the ability to flare your brass, rioting multiple creatures at the same time. You can riot the bloodlust in your allies, allowing all creatures you choose within 30 feet to add your emotion die to their next damage roll. Doing so expends three brass charges.

entries.name: Zinc and Brass
entries: You learn to burn your zinc and brass in conjunction for an edge in battle. Your soothing lets you reduce emotions you don't need and your rioting lets you stress the emotions you want. While twinning zinc and brass the buffs and debuffs you grant use an emotion die one level higher than the one you usually use. This persists even when you are no longer twinning the metals, but you may only have one enhanced buff and one enhanced debuff active at any time.

entries.name: Zinc
entries: You learn to soothe away negative influences on your allies. When dragging zinc creatures of your choice within 30ft have advantage on saves against being charmed or frightened.

entries.name: Brass
entries: You learn to riot the need to survive in those around you. When dragging brass creatures of your choice within 30ft have advantage on death saving throws.

entries.name: Zinc
entries: You've become so used to burning zinc it has become second nature. When you roll below a ten on a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) or Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check you may flare your zinc to dampen others' doubt. When you do so you may roll another d20 and add the result to the check. Doing so expends two zinc charges.

entries.name: Brass
entries: You've become so used to burning brass it has become second nature. When a creature within 30ft misses an attack or fails a saving throw you may flare your brass and riot their determination, allowing them to repeat their last action at no additional cost to them. Doing so expends three brass charges.

entries.name: Zinc and Brass
entries: You learn to improve your zinc and brass twinning. When greater twinning there is no restriction on the number of enhanced buffs and debuffs you may have active.

item.name: Allomantic Steelpush
entries: You impart a great force on a tiny metal object, such as a ball bearing or a copper piece.

item.name: Coinshot Steelpush
entries: You impart a great force on a tiny metal object, such as a ball bearing or a copper piece. Damage from your Coinshot Steelpush is magical.

This attack launches multiple objects at higher levels: two objects at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the objects at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each one.

item.name: Flared Coinshot Steelpush
entries: You impart a great force on a tiny metal object, such as a ball bearing or a copper piece. Damage from your Coinshot Steelpush is magical.

This attack launches multiple objects at higher levels: two objects at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the objects at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each one.

entries.name: Special
entries: You burn all of your steel at once, pushing a tiny metal object at great speed. The damage of this push varies with the number of charges expended when the duralumin is burned. This projectile deals (# of charges expended) * d6 magical piercing damage. If the creature hit is size Huge or smaller they must also succeed on a Strength saving throw with DC (# of charges expended + 12) or fall prone.

item.name: Staff of Minor Striking
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

The staff has 3 charges. When you hit with a melee attack using it, you can expend any number of charges. For each charge you expend, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. The staff regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Inverse Driftglobe
entries: This small sphere of thick glass weighs 1 pound. If you are within 60 feet of it, you can speak its command word and cause it to emanate the {@spell darkness} spell. Once used, the {@spell darkness} effect can't be used again until the next dawn.

You can speak another command word as an action to make the shadowed globe rise into the air and float no more than 5 feet off the ground. The globe hovers in this way until you or another creature grasps it. If you move more than 60 feet from the hovering globe, it follows you until it is within 60 feet of you. It takes the shortest route to do so. If prevented from moving, the globe sinks gently to the ground and becomes inactive, and its light winks out.

item.name: Pyroconverger
entries: A Pyroconverger is a foot long black wrought iron sculpture of a scorpion with a metallic tube driven into the mouth and a trigger on the tail.

The scorpion carries 5 charges, which recharge on a long rest of the most recent person to use the device. When the trigger is pulled, a charge is expended and a burst of green flame fills the area of a ten foot cone in front of the device. All creatures caught in the cone must attempt a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} fire damage and have their movement be reduced by half. On a successful save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage and its movement is unaffected. If all creatures succeed on their saving throw, an additional charge is lost.

Should the device lose all of its charges, it will explode on initiative count 20, causing those in a 20 foot radius around it to take {@damage 12d6} fire damage and make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw against being knocked prone.

item.name: Patishvat's Corrupting Pamphlet
entries: An artifact from before the Sundering, back when the Order was active. Patishvat's Corrupting Pamphlet is a masterwork of hundreds of layers of different kinds of magic, most of which made by techniques no longer known to mortals.

The Pamphlet was said to have contained information on how to locate Patishvat's mobile wizard tower, likely for recruiting the strong mages that could pass the trials administered by the Pamphlet. However, over the years the magic inside the artifact has run rampant, changing the words inside to gibberish and corrupting the trials into their most simple functions. A skilled wizard, artificer, or enchanter might be able to restore the original functionality given enough time, however.
Now all that remains of the pamphlet are its storage and duplication abilities, which can still provide immense functionality in the right hands.

entries.name: Duplication
entries: Likely a remainder of the Pamphlet's ability to generate foes for its trials, the artifact can create perfect duplications of any creature that touches it. A non-attuned creature that touches the Pamphlet must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against a 13 DC or the artifact will materialize a clone, expending one of its three charges to do so. The clone is identical in every way to the original except that it is vulnerable to force damage, hostile to everyone but prioritizes targeting its original, and will dissipate exactly one hour after its creation. The same creature cannot be cloned more than once in a 24 hour span. The Pamphlet's charges are restored at dawn.

entries.name: Capture
entries: A fragment of the Pamphlet's trial generation functionality, the artifact can store and release creatures within its pages. The wielder of the pamphlet may hold it against a creature of Huge or smaller size for one minute, at the end of which the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw against 15 DC. On a failure, the creature is drawn into the Pamphlet. The Pamphlet has ten units of storage, where the size of a creature is represented by an amount shown in the table below.

While stored inside the Pamphlet, the creature has no need for food, water, or sleep, but does still age. As an action you may release one creature from the pamphlet into an open space within five feet. When the Pamphlet is used in this way, the Duplication effect does not occur.
When the Pamphlet is the target of a {@spell Dispel Magic} spell, all of its charges are expended harmlessly, and any creatures stored within are immediately released.

trait.name: Platforms
entries: The Hellforged Titan has two platforms built into its chassis. One Medium or smaller creature can ride on each platform without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within 5 feet of the warforged, they must use spears or weapons with reach and the target must be Large or larger.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The Hellforged Titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Hellforged Titan makes one axehand attack and one hammerfist attack.

action.name: Axehand
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage, plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage if the target is {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hammerfist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sweeping Axe {@recharge}
entries: The Hellforged Titan makes a sweep with its axehand, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Almonk's Arcane Drain
entries: A silvery ray of energy shoots from your hand to one creature you can see, ripping a hole in their connection to the Weave. That creature must make a saving throw in your spellcasting ability (e.g. if a Wizard casts this spell they must make an Intelligence saving throw, if a Warlock casts it it's a Charisma saving throw, etc.) On a failure, the creature loses one 4th-level spell slot as if the spell was cast. If it has no 4th-level spells, it loses a 3rd-level slot instead; if it has no 3rd-level slot, it loses a 2nd-level spell; and so on. Arcane Drain has no effect on creatures that don't have spell slots.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Arcane Drain can be cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher. It wipes out a spell slot one level higher than the slot used to cast the spell.

spell.name: Almonk's Arcane Siphon
entries: A small, black orb hovers around your head, seemingly drawing magical effects into it. The next time you're targeted with a single-target spell of third level or lower, the spell is instead drawn into the orb. You regain one spell slot of a level one lower than the spell that was caught. If the spell was a first level spell, you do not regain a slot. The orb cannot catch cantrips, and once the orb has caught a spell the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Arcane Siphon can be cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher. It can catch spells of equal or lower level to the spell slot expended to cast it.

spell.name: Almonk's Retribution

components.m: a pinch of ash from a cremated spellcaster

entries: You ignite the Weave in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see. For the duration of the spell, any creature casting a spell within the area of the sphere takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage, or half damage with a successful Constitution saving throw. Their spell successfully finishes casting regardless of their save.

spell.name: Anomalous Object
entries: By touching an object, you retrieve another version of the object from elsewhere in time. You must select the exact time that you retrieve the object from. If the object is attended, you must succeed on a melee spell attack roll against the creature holding or controlling the object. Any effect that affects the original object also affects the duplicate (charges spent, damage taken, etc.) and any effect that affects the duplicate also affects the original object. If either object is destroyed, both are destroyed.

spell.name: Antimagic Shroud
entries: A black, translucent shroud surrounds your body, seemingly absorbingly light into it. The first time you take damage from a spell, the shroud explodes towards the caster and the spell ends. The creature who targeted you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Arcane Censure
entries: You attempt to completely cut off a creature from the Weave. The creature must make a saving throw in their spellcasting ability against your spell save DC. On a failure, they lose all spellcasting ability, including innate spellcasting. Only a Wish can undo the effects of this spell.

spell.name: Arcane Interdiction
entries: You stress the Weave in a 60-foot-radius sphere around you, making it harder to cast spells. When you move, the sphere moves with you. Any creature in the area, including you, must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC when they try to cast a spell; if the saving throw fails, the spell also fails (it has no effect) and the spell slot is expended. A creature concentrating on a spell while within the sphere must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or it loses concentration. You are exempt from this effect for the sake of maintaining this spell.

spell.name: Arcane Tattoo
entries: You scribe a tattoo on a willing creature's skin that holds a portion of magical essence. A creature can only hold one arcane tattoo at a time; scribing another eliminates the previous one.
The recipient of the tattoo can activate the tattoo's effect as a bonus action. Once the tattoo is scribed, it remains until the effect is activated.
The tattoo types are as follows:

entries.name: Red
entries: The recipient goes into a battle frenzy, gaining advantage on melee attacks for 1 minute.

entries.name: Yellow
entries: The recipient's Strength score increases to 19 for 10 minutes.

entries.name: Green
entries: The recipient's speed increases to 60 feet for 1 minute, and opportunity attacks against the recipient have disadvantage.

entries.name: Purple
entries: The recipient gains advantage on Stealth checks for 10 minutes.

spell.name: Ashen Pack
entries: With a gesture, you draw upon the depths of the Abyss to summon three flaming wolves made from ash into your space. When you cast this spell, and as an action on each of your turns while it is in effect, you can choose a creature within 60 feet of you. When you do, one of the flaming wolves rushes to the creature, making a melee spell attack using your spell attack modifier. If the attack hits, the target takes {@damage 4d10} fire damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or they are knocked {@condition prone}. The flaming wolf then immediately returns to your space, coiling around your feet. The wolves have an AC equal to your spell save DC. If a flaming wolf is struck by a weapon or spell attack or is prevented from returning to your space after making an attack, it vanishes. The spell ends when all three wolves are lost, or you lose concentration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the fire damage of the wolf's attack increases by {@scaledice 4d10|4-9|1d10} per spell slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Attraction
entries: You concentrate gravity around your body. Each creature within 15 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and is pulled up to 10 feet toward you. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and is not pulled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Awkward
entries: You cause a creature to temporarily lose some of its charisma. The targeted creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw fails, it subtracts {@damage 1d6} from any Charisma checks, saving throws, and attack rolls, and it is unable to benefit from advantage on those checks. It can't use any ability that would allow rerolls on these checks because it is unaware that the performance is going poorly.

spell.name: Mental Balance

components.m: a blindfold and a set of scales

entries: You temporarily remove all of a creature's emotional attachments or biases. While under the effect of this spell, the creature gains advantage on saving throws against illusion and memetic spells. All decisions the creature makes while under the spell's influence must follow the spirit and letter of the law, and the subject is incapable of showing favoritism.

spell.name: Bestial Rage
entries: You draw upon the collective's memory of wildshaping to refine your wildshaping. As part of casting this spell, you also transform as through the Wild Shape ability. Doing so still expends a charge of wildshape, and you cannot cast this spell if you have no charges remaining.

You increase the speed and power of your wildshape but also increase its bulk. For the duration of this wildshape you have advantage on all melee attacks, but all melee attacks on you have advantage as well. The effect ends when you lose your form.

spell.name: Blades of Bone
entries: You turn your wildshaping energy inward, growing long, sharp spurs of bone all over your body. You deal {@damage 3d6} piercing damage to your target when you successfully initiate a grapple. You deal another {@damage 2d6} damage at the start of your turn to any creature you have {@condition grappled}.

spell.name: Blithering Gibberish
entries: You partially obscure the mental faculties of a target. One creature you can see must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature is cursed and becomes incapable of producing intelligible speech for the duration of the spell. The creature is also unable to cast spells with a verbal component. At the end of each of the creature's turns, it can repeat the saving throw. A successful save ends the spell. A spell that removes a curse can also end the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast Blithering Gibberish with a 4th-level or higher spell slot, the creature is also unable to understand spoken language for the duration of the spell. If you use an 8th-level or higher spell slot, the duration becomes permanent and the creature can't make saving throws to end the effect.

spell.name: Body Enhancement: Claws
entries: You draw upon the collective's memory of wildshaping to partially modify your body. You replace your fingers with magically sharp claws, so that your unarmed strikes do {@damage 2d6} slashing damage. You are proficient with your unarmed strikes.

spell.name: Body Enhancement: Fangs
entries: You draw upon the collective's memory of wildshaping to partially modify your body. You transform your mouth into the jaws of a beast. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} piercing damage, and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Body Enhancement: Hide
entries: You draw upon the collective's memory of wildshaping to partially modify your body. You thicken your skin into the coarse, strong texture of a beast's. Until the spell ends your base AC becomes 13 + your Constitution modifier. The spell ends if you don armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

spell.name: Body Enhancement: Horns
entries: You draw upon the collective's memory of wildshaping to partially modify your body. You grow pointed horns on your forehead and rush at a target within range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d12} bludgeoning damage. If you move at least 20 feet straight at the target before casting this spell, you can choose one of the following effects to inflict upon it on a hit:

items: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you.
The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target takes an additional {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Body Enhancement: Mind
entries: You draw upon the collective's knowledge to deepen your understanding. For the duration of the spell, you can use your Wisdom score and modifier in place of your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution score and modifier. Choose which ability score will be replaced when you cast the spell.

spell.name: Body Enhancement: Sense
entries: You draw upon the collective's memory of wildshaping to partially modify your body. You modify either your eyes, ears, or nose to become more beastlike. Choose one of the following senses: hearing, smell, or sight. Until the spell ends, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on that sense.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 2nd-level spell slot, your can choose two senses instead of just one. When you cast this spell using a slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose all three senses.

spell.name: Bodydouble
entries: You twist space in such a way that you can be in two places at once. You gain control of a double that begins by occupying the same space as you. As a bonus action, you can move the double up to 20 feet away from you; you can also use it as the source of any weapon attack you make or spell you cast, as if you were standing in the double's spot. At the end of your turn, the double returns to your space.
The bodydouble can't be damaged or even attacked. It has no real, physical presence except in the moment when it attacks.

spell.name: Bound Minds

components.m: two halves of a locket or necklace

entries: You create a direct mental link between two willing creatures. Each becomes perpetually aware of the other's location accurately enough to find the other even when blindfolded. They are aware of each other's physical and emotional condition at all times. This knowledge doesn't give any information about the subject's surroundingsâ€”one of the spell's recipients could know that the other is 10 miles away in a castle and distraught, for example, but wouldn't know that the other person is chained to a wall and awaiting trial for witchcraft.
A person can be under the effect of only one bound hearts spell at a time, and it's not possible for more than two people to be simultaneously linked by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If Bound Minds is cast using a 9th-level slot, the duration becomes permanent.

spell.name: Bubble Bubble
entries: You summon a bubble from the Feywild that floats quickly toward one creature within range. If the creature fails a Dexterity saving throw, the bubble bursts over it and covers it with goop. Creatures covered with goop suffer a âˆ’2 penalty to attack rolls and Dexterity checks, and their speed is reduced by 10 feet. In addition, creatures covered in bubble goop can't cast spells with somatic components.
The bubble goop remains until the affected creature uses an action to make a Dexterity check against your spell DC to scrape it off.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot used higher than 4th level, you can create one additional bubble. Each bubble can be targeted against a different creature.

spell.name: Carnage
entries: You snap, ripping holes in the fabric of space and putting as much force as you can into your attacks. When you cast this spell, you teleport 120 feet and make a melee weapon attack against all creatures within your reach. Roll a single attack for all targets. If you hit a creature, it takes an additional {@dice 6d12} force damage. On your subsequent turns, you can use your action to continue your carnage. Each time you use this action, it has a different effect:

items.name: 2nd Use
entries: You teleport up to 60 feet and make a melee weapon attack against all creatures within a 20-foot-cone. Each creature you hit is knocked prone and takes an additional {@dice 6d12} force damage.

items.name: 3rd Use
entries: You teleport up to 30 feet and make a single melee weapon attack against a creature within reach. If the creature is above half its maximum hit points, this attack inflicts an additional {@dice 6d12} force damage. If you hit, the creature is then {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn.

items.name: 4th Use
entries: You teleport up to 60 feet into the air and descend, smashing into the ground at a point of your choosing that you can see within 120 feet of your starting point. You take no falling damage, but each creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. If they fail, they take {@dice 6d12} force damage. You then make a melee weapon attack targeting a creature within reach. If you hit, the target takes an additional {@dice 8d12} force damage.

spell.name: Celestial Preservation
entries: You can cast this spell only at night. You memorialize a dead creature you touch, turning it into a constellation, provided that it has been dead no longer than 1 day. The target's body dissolves into stardust and rises into the sky.

The spell effectively extends the time limit on raising the target from the dead, since days spent under the influence of this spell don't count against the time limit of spells such as {@spell raise dead}. A spell that targets the dead but usually requires a body can be cast targeting this constellation instead, provided the spell is cast at night and the caster can see the target's constellation. If the target of this spell is returned to life, this spell ends and the constellation fades.

spell.name: Cerebral Disruption
entries: You completely rewire the memory-forming part of a target creature's brain. The creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature loses {@dice 2d6} points of Intelligence (to a minimum of 3) and must roll on the following table to see how it is cursed. On a successful save, the creature loses half that amount of Intelligence and suffers no additional effect.

rows: The target is {@condition frightened} of you.

The target develops a severe phobia to a common object. Anytime the target is within 15 feet of the object and is able to perceive it, he or she becomes {@condition frightened} until the object is again more than 15 feet away. You choose the subject of the phobia. The object should be common, but not ubiquitous. For example, "wooden spoons" would be an appropriate subject, but "shoes" would not.
The target automatically fails Intelligence checks.
The target is confused (per the {@spell confusion} spell).
The target suffers amnesia and is unable to recall details of its past or cast spells.
The target's mind regresses to a childlike state.

entries: The curse effect can be ended by remove curse or comparable magic, and greater restoration or comparable magic can repair the ability loss. Otherwise, the effects of this spell are permanent.

spell.name: Charming
entries: You twist fate to make you naturally more charming. When you cast the spell, each creature that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw (with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it). If the saving throw fails, it is {@condition charmed} by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. {@condition Charmed} creatures regard you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, affected creatures do not realize they were {@condition charmed} by you.

spell.name: Charming Memory
entries: You plant temporary, false, pleasant memories of yourself in another's mind. While the spell is active you may endear yourself to those around you and add {@damage 1d4} to any Charisma check or saving throw.

spell.name: Checkpoint

components.m: a shard of Lasinium worth at least 1,000 gold pieces, which the spell consumes

entries: You create a checkpoint of a creature you touch at full health. If the creature drops unconscious during the duration of this spell, it revives back to full health at the beginning of its next turn. The spell ends once the creature is revived.

spell.name: Chrysalis
entries: You drastically speed up the flow of time for a willing creature, allowing it to take a long rest in the span of one hour. The target of this spell becomes wrapped in a thick but fragile cocoon. While in the cocoon, the subject doesn't need to eat or drink. At the end of the hour, it emerges from the cocoon as if it had just completed a long rest. While within the cocoon, however, the creature is completely cut off from outside stimuli.

The chrysalis has 1 hit point and AC 10. If it is destroyed, the spell ends and the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the spell is ended in this fashion, the creature does not get the benefits of a long rest.

spell.name: Compressive Weapon
entries: You compress the space between your weapon and a creature you can see, reducing the distance required to strike them. You have advantage on your next two attack rolls against the target before the spell ends.

spell.name: Cone of Decay
entries: You create a 60-foot-long cone originating from your hand. All unattended, nonliving, organic matter within the cone crumbles to dust. Each creature in the cone must make a Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails, all the creature's nonmagical, organic gear (food, drink, cloth, leather, etc.) is destroyed and all nonmagical, metal gear takes a permanent -1 penalty to its stats (AC for armor and attack/damage for weaponry).
Undead creatures additionally lose 4 points of Constitution, or 2 points if they made a successful Constitution saving throw.

spell.name: Cone of Silence
entries: You stop the flow of information in an area you can see. You create a 90-foot-cone eminating from your eyes in which all noise is silenced. Any creature or object within the cone is immune to thunder damage and is {@condition deafened}. The cone follows your line of sight as you move.

spell.name: Containment Orbs
entries: You are surrounded by three small orbs of multicolored force that can absorb certain spells. When you cast containment orbs, you choose a school of magic for each orb (e.g., abjuration, evocation, planara). Any spells of the appropriate type that would affect you are absorbed by the corresponding orb and have no further effect.

Each orb can absorb only one spell. Once an orb has absorbed a spell, you can use an action to cause it to explode. All creatures within 20 feet of you take {@dice 2d6} damage per level of the spell the orb absorbed, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw. The DC for the saving throw is set by you, not by the spell's original caster.
An orb is destroyed after it has exploded. All orbs disappear with no further effect when the spell ends.

spell.name: Copy
entries: This spell creates a perfect duplicate of any written or drawn document that you touch onto blank pages you supply. You can copy up to 50 pages of text with one casting of this spell. Magical writing, including spellbook pages, can be copied with this spell, but do not retain any magical properties.

spell.name: Darkseeker's Aura

components.m: a small piece of a poisonous beetle

entries: A swirling mist of corrosive black vapor from Gehenna engulfs your body for the duration of this spell. Any creature that strikes you with a melee attack takes {@damage 4d6} acid damage, and you gain resistance to acid damage.
As an action, you can make a melee spell attack against one creature within your reach; a hit does {@damage 10d6} acid damage and ends this spell.

spell.name: Darkseeker's Restraint
entries: You summon great binding chains from Gehenna to restrain a target. Choose a creature you can see within 90 feet. The target must make a successful Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by stygian chains and take {@damage 6d8} bludgeoning damage. A restrained creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save. While restrained this way, the creature also takes {@damage 6d8} bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns.

spell.name: Deja Vu

time.condition: taken after a creature is the target of an attack

components.m: a small mirror and a small mirror

entries: You twist the strands of time to force a creature to relive a past trauma. As a reaction to a creature being the target of an attack, you can force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell DC or suffer the same amount and type of damage it had just taken, up to a cap of 24. Additionally, if the creature made a saving throw as part of the previous attack and succeeded, it must remake the saving throw with disadvantage or suffer the original effects.

spell.name: Disperse Magic

time.condition: which you take when you are forced to make a saving throw against a spell or magical effect

entries: You redirect some of the magical energy targeting you back into the Weave. You gain advantage on the saving throw against the spell or magical effect. Additionally, if the effect allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, or half damage if you fail.

spell.name: Disrupt Movement
entries: You send ripples of contracted space toward three separate targets. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw or its speed is halved and it gains disadvantage on Dexterity ability checks. An affected creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can create an additional ripple to target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Divine Regression
entries: You reverse the flow of magic in a creature, removing their ability to heal. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, and is blocked from healing. Instead of restoring hitpoints, the creature takes necrotic damage equal to the amount normally healed while afflicted. The effect ends if the duration of the spell ends, or the target has a spell like remove curse or stronger used on them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level above 2nd, the creature takes an additional {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage on a hit.

spell.name: Djura's Divine Protection
entries: You grant up to eight willing creatures within range a hardened layer of air compressed to the point of becoming solid around their bodies. For the duration of the spell, the target creatures gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, and force damage. Additionally, all affected creatures have advantage on death saving throws.

spell.name: Djura's Divine Razor
entries: You sharpen your blade to cut through the fabric of reality itself. The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this turn, your attack inflicts an additional {@damage 2d10} force damage, and the target becomes afflicted by a malignant curse. Until the spell ends, whenever you take the Attack action, you can choose to attack the cursed creature regardless of distance or obstacles, and these attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d10} force damage, ignore cover, and cannot suffer disadvantage.

spell.name: Djura's Righteous Pressure
entries: You radiate a great pressure in a 30-foot radius that is anathema to undead and fiends. Any undead or fiend that enters the aura or begins its turn in the aura takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage and must make a Constitution saving throw; if the saving throw fails, the creature is forced out of the radius and cannot attempt to reenter until its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast with a spell slot higher than 4th, the pressure may affect all humanoids as well as undead and fiends.

spell.name: Do My Bidding
entries: You ask fate for the right words to rally a crowd to your cause. You can sway a large group of people toward accomplishing a specific goal. You must speak emphatically on the subject for 10 minutes, playing on the crowd's emotions and reason, to inflame their fervor for or against a cause or person. You must be clear about the specific goal you want to achieve. For example, shouting that "The Church of Reostadt is evil and corrupt!" might make people dislike the church, but it won't spur them to action because it doesn't tell them what to do. Adding "Follow me, and we'll burn it to the ground!" will send a crowd of torch-bearing arsonists to Xanathar himself.
The spell affects all sentient creatures that are able to hear and understand you within 60 feet.

When you finish casting the spell, all potential targets of the spell who fail a Wisdom saving throw are compelled to follow your instructions for the duration of the spell, as long as those orders are in keeping with the goal stated in the speech and you personally lead them. If these conditions aren't met, the spell ends and the crowd becomes hostile toward you. The spell also ends when the goal has been achieved. If the goal is achieved or the duration ends naturally, those under the affect of the spell do not realize they were charmed by you.

spell.name: Earworm
entries: You implant a small worm made of arcane thread into the skin of another creature. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the worm seats itself in a vantage point close to the creature's ears. You can hear any sounds the target hears as long as you and the target are on the same plane of existence. The worm safely dissolves once the spell ends.

spell.name: Ebb and Flow
entries: You detach a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choosing from the natural flow of time.
Allies gain an additional 10 feet of movement and can take a second reaction on turns they begin within the sphere.

Enemies must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spellcasting DC or their movement is reduced by 10 feet and they can only take either an action or bonus action on turns they begin within the sphere. Additionally, those who fail their saving throw cannot make multiattacks inside the sphere.

spell.name: Eldrich Horror

m.text: black pearl worth at least 500 gp, which is consumed in the casting

entries: You create a portal to the Far Realms inside a 10-foot circle that opens in the floor centered on a point you can see. Creatures standing on the portal when it opens can make a Dexterity saving throw to jump to the nearest safe space and avoid being drawn through the portal inadvertently.

Immediately after the portal appears, four 30-foot-long tendrils emerge from it. When you cast the spell and at the beginning of each of your turns, each tendril tries to grapple one creature; you select the targets. Make a melee spell attack for each tendril. If it hits, the target is {@condition grappled} and dragged 10 feet toward the portal. Instead of attacking, a tendril that already has a creature {@condition grappled} drags it another 10 feet closer to the portal. {@condition Grappled} creatures can escape by making appropriate ability checks against your spell saving throw DC.

Creatures that fall or are pulled into the portal no longer exist on the plane where Eldrich Horror was cast; they are inside the realm where the tendrils originate. They must make Constitution saving throws at the start of each of their turns. If the saving throw fails, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and its maximum hit points are reduced by the same number. As an action, the creature can try to escape by making a Strength check against your spell saving throw DC at the end of their turn; if it succeeds, it appears in the unoccupied space closest to the portal.
When the spell ends, creatures pulled through the portal reappear in the portal's space, alive or dead.

spell.name: Elemental Sink
entries: You form an elemental sink on a creature you can see within range. You choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder for the damage type of the spell. Until the spell ends, each time you attack the Weave empties magical energy into the creature, dealing an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the type chosen to the target.
If you roll a 6 on the damage die of this spell, the creature suffers an additional effect depending on the damage type chosen:

items: {@b Acid:} One creature within 5 feet of the target takes acid damage equal to your spellcasting modifier.
{@b Cold:} The target has his speed reduced by 10 until the end of its next turn.
{@b Fire:} The targets radiate 10 feet bright light until the end of its next turn and the next attack against it has advantage.
{@b Lightning:} The target cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.
{@b Thunder:} The target is pushed 10 ft. away from you.

entries: If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to move the sink to a new creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.

spell.name: Erase
entries: This spell destroys any writing or drawing on an object you touch, so long as the object has less than 100 pages or the surface area of the object is less than 50 square feet. The object itself is unharmed, and appears to have never been written on in the first place. This can effect magical writing, including spellbooks and glyphs.

spell.name: Excavation
entries: For the duration of this spell, you can excavate a cube 10 feet to a side of earth, sand, stone, or mud each round. You can expand an existing hole or start a new one. You can't dig through artifically constructed stone, such as in a building or wall. The earth removed from the hole is returned to the Plane of Earth.

You can also use this spell to tunnel through earth. If the tunnel is longer than 10 feet, it has a 30% chance of collapsing (1â€“6 on {@damage 1d20}), +5% for every 5 feet beyond 30 feet, unless the tunnel is braced or supported.
Most creatures can easily react quickly enough to step aside automatically if you try digging beneath them, no saving throw necessary.

spell.name: Extra Motivation
entries: You ask fate to grant you just a little more energy, and your wish is granted. You regain 4 spell slots of 5th level or lower.

When you cast this spell, you can choose take more than is offered, rejuvenating yourself even more greatly for a price. You may willingly take necrotic damage equal to half your current hit points. This damage ignores both damage resistance and damage immunity. If you do so, you regain the expended uses of up to three abilities which normally recover when you take a rest.
Once you cast this spell, you cannot cast this spell again for 24 hours, even if you have an available 9th level spell slot.

spell.name: Extraplanar Beam
entries: You fire a beam of pulsing violet light harvested from the space between planes. You produce a beam of radiance in a line, 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 10d8} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded} on a successful one.
A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition blinded}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Extraplanar Pulse
entries: You hurl a ball of pulsing violet light harvested from the space between planes. Make a ranged spell attack against a single creature within range. On a hit, it takes {@damage 5d6} radiant damage and must make a Constitution save or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Falling Star
entries: You summon a sliver of pure, solid phlogiston at a point within range. All creatures within a 40-foot-radius sphere around the point must make a Constitution saving throw to steel against the detonation. If they fail, they take {@damage 10d6} radiant damage, or half as much damage if they succeed. This spell creates bright light that shines in a 100-foot radius until the end of your next turn, and this light counts as natural sunlight.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radiant damage increases by {@scaledice 10d6|5-9|1d6} per spell slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Farsight
entries: You empower a magic circle that links to sigils of seeing you previously created. You can select a number of sigils up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). The distance between the circle of scrying and the sigils of seeing is not a factor, and the sigils can even be on other planes of existence.

When you stand inside your circle of scrying, you can view the area around any of the linked sigils as if you were actually standing at the location of the sigil. You can switch between different sigils as an action.

The casting time for the spell depends on whether the circle is being drawn anew or a previously placed, permanent circle is being empowered. Drawing a new circle takes one day. Empowering a previously placed, permanent circle takes 1 minute.
Drawing a new circle requires material components costing 250 gold pieces. The circle is typically a flat design of a geometric shape with a 5-foot radius.

A sigil of seeing is created spending one minute drawing the sigil on a flat surface. Each sigil requires special ink that costs 100 gold pieces per sigil. The sigil disappears within moments of being drawn, but it reappears when you are scrying through it. A sigil is typically no more an inch in diameter. While a sigil is in use, it can be noticed by anyone who examines the spot where it's drawn and makes a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) check. While the sigil isn't in use, finding it requires a deliberate search of the correct area and a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell saving throw DC.

spell.name: Fast-Forward

m.text: 750gp worth of Nothing, which is consumed in the casting

entries: You attempt to force a creature far into its own future. One creature you touch must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or else become cursed with age. The creature becomes wizened and enfeebled and has disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution-based ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. It does half damage with weapon attacks.
This effect can be ended by magic that removes curses.

spell.name: Fault Line
entries: You rupture the ground along a 60-foot line that you designate. All spaces affected by the spell become difficult terrain. In addition, all creatures in an affected space are knocked {@condition prone} and take {@damage 8d6} bludgeoning damaging. Creatures that make a successful Dexterity saving throw take half damage and are not knocked prone.  This spell doesn't damage permanent structures.

spell.name: Festering Slick
entries: You touch a melee weapon and imbue it with slick, antillurgic energy. The first time that weapon successfully hits during this spell's duration, the slick creeps off the weapon and into its target's wounds. The attack deals an extra {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage to the target. Additionally its flesh festers and refuses to repair. Until the spell ends, the target cannot regain hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@scaledice 3d6|3-9|1d6} per spell slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Flashback
entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target can revisit its memory of an event that it experienced within the last 24 hours. While a creature is revisiting a memory through this spell, it is {@condition paralyzed} and hears sounds as if they came from far away. Additionally, you and up to 5 allies of your choice can share in visiting the memory, seeing through the target's eyes and hearing what it heard, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the target had. During this time, you are deaf and blind. If this spell ends due to failure to maintain concentration, both you and the affected creature take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the target can choose an event that took place up to 7 days ago (2nd level), 30 days ago (3rd level), 1 year ago (4th level), or any time in the target's past (5th level).

spell.name: Flicker

components.m: a tuft of displacer beast fur

entries: You gain better control of the eddies in the space around you, letting you find small shortcuts from place to place. For the duration of the spell, you can use your bonus action to teleport 5 feet. Additionally, when you are targeted by an attack you can use your reaction to attempt to teleport out of harm's way. Roll a d20. On a roll of 11 or higher, the attack automatically misses, and you teleport 5 feet. Otherwise, the attack is made as normal and you teleport 5 feet shortly after.

spell.name: Fluid Form
entries: You turn your wildshape abilities inward, to reconstruct your form. You transform yourself and all items you are carrying into thick liquid. The amount of liquid has the same mass and volume as your normal body, but it is amorphous, allowing you to squeeze through gaps that are at least an inch wide. In this form, you are immune to poison, paralysis, and stun. Your speed becomes 20 feet.
